nigerian.text: A mother is gold, a father is a mirror.
In the moment of crisis, the wise build bridges and the foolish build dams.
Ugliness with a good character is better than beauty.
If there is character, ugliness becomes beauty; if there is none, beauty becomes ugliness.
He who marries a beauty marries trouble.
Greatness and beauty do not belong to the gods alone.
When brothers fight to the death, a stranger inherits their father’s estate.
Beauty is not sold and eaten.
If you find "Miss This Year" beautiful, then you’ll find "Miss Next Year" even more so.
Rain does not make friends with anybody—it falls on any person it meets outside.
The house roof fights the rain, but he who is sheltered ignores it.
Being happy in one’s home is better than being a chief.
You know who you love, but you can’t know who loves you.
Until lions have their own historians, accounts of the hunt will always celebrate the hunter.
A wealthy man will always have followers.
If you say yes, your [personal] God will also say yes.
When the mouse laughs at the cat, there is a hole nearby.
When the music changes, so does the dance.
By labor comes wealth.
The wealth which enslaves the owner isn’t wealth.
Lack of money is lack of friends; if you have money at your disposal, every dog and goat will claim to be related to you.
When brothers fight to the death, a stranger inherits their father’s estate.
If you think you have someone eating out of your hands, it is a good idea to count your fingers.
It is the toothless animal that arrives first at the base of the fruit tree, to eat his fill before others arrive.
Little by little the bird builds its nest.
The Rhinoceros never dances with the monkey.
The roaring lion kills no prey.
Time destroys all things.
Ugliness with a good character is better than beauty.
We are what our thinking makes us.
Wealth diminishes with usage; learning increases with use.
When the mouse laughs at the cat, there is a hole nearby.
When the music changes, so does the dance.
When the roots of a tree begin to decay, it spreads death to the branches.
In the moment of crisis, the wise build bridges and the foolish build dams.
Other people’s wisdom prevents the king from being called a fool.
Wealth diminishes with usage; learning increases with use.
Beauty is not sold and eaten.
Greatness and beauty do not belong to the gods alone.
He who marries a beauty marries trouble.
If there is character, ugliness becomes beauty; if there is none, beauty becomes ugliness.
If you find Miss This Year" beautiful, then you’ll find Miss Next Year" even more so.
Ugliness with a good character is better than beauty.
Even as the archer loves the arrow that flies, so too he loves the bow that remains constant in his hands.
One does not love if one does not accept from others.
You know who you love but you can’t know who loves you.
A housewife who complains that there is not enough foodstuff in the market should remember that if her husband adds to what is already available, there would be more for everyone.
Fine words do not produce food.
Look for a black goat while it is still daytime.
The frowning of a goat does not prevent it from being priced in the market.
No matter how good you are to a goat it will still eat your yam.
A bird that flies from the ground onto an anthill does not know that it is still on the ground.
A child who is carried on the back will not know how far the journey is.
A doctor who invoked a storm on his people cannot prevent his house from destruction.
A man cannot sit down alone to plan for prosperity.
A Mothers Tenderness for her children is as discrete as the dew that kisses the Earth.
A person who has children does not die.
A bird that flies off the earth and lands on an anthill is still on the ground.
A short person hangs his bag where his hand can reach.
The big game often appears when the hunter has given up the hunt for the day.
When the mother goat breaks into the yam store her kid watches her.
When a once-beautiful piece of cloth has turned into rags, no one remembers that it was woven by Ukwa master weavers.
No one gets a mouthful of food by picking between another person’s teeth.
If a snake does not act like a snake, little children will use it to tie firewood.
A tree does not move unless there is wind.
Being happy is better than being king.
Every kind of love is love, but self-love is supreme among them.
Always being in a hurry does not prevent death, neither does going slowly prevent living.
Words are sweet, but they never take the place of food.
The rain does not recognize anyone as a friend it drenches all equally.
When a once-beautiful piece of cloth has turned into rags, no one remembers that it was woven by Ukwa master weavers.
Wealth diminishes with usage; learning increases with use.
What you give you get, ten times over.
Anyone who sees beauty and does not look at it will soon be poor.
You must be willing to die in order to live.
Frowning and fierceness do not prove manliness.
It takes a whole village to raise a child.
nigerian.description: The society is responsible for the moral characters it creates and everyone in a community should be responsible for helping to train a child irrespective of who the parents are; offering correction where they are needed.

nigerian.text: Character is religion.
The person who has been a slave from birth does not value rebellion.
Medicine left in the bottle can’t help.
Truth came to market but could not be sold; however, we buy lies with ready cash.
When the rain falls in the valley, the hill gets angry.
Gossips always suspect that others are talking about them.
Diseased genitals must keep to themselves.
When hunger gets inside you, nothing else can.
When wood breaks it can be repaired, but ivory breaks forever.
Stop the old and try something new.
One avoids danger at the early stage.
The hand of the child cannot reach the shelf, nor the hand of the adult get through the neck of the gourd.
Silence is an attribute of the dead; he who is alive speaks.
No one rides a horse without moving his head, voluntarily or involuntarily.
Those who die through ignorance are many; those who die because they are intelligent are few.
When a king’s palace burns down, the re-built palace is more beautiful .
We must blame the thief first before we say that where the owner put her property improper.
Little by little is how the pig’s nose enters the yard.
What you give you get, ten times over.
One is in a dilemma to choose between two conditions by weighing the merits and demerits.
You need a long spoon to dine with the devil.
Patching makes a garment last long.
Work is the medicine for poverty.
He is an enemy who slanders one’s name.
He who marries a beauty marries trouble.
He who throws a stone in the market will hit his relative.
If you damage the character of another, you damage your own.
If you send no one to the market, the market will send no one to you.
Inquiry saves a man from mistakes.
News is interesting from the mouth of him who tells it first.
One does not enter into the water and then run from the cold.
One does not fight to save another person’s head only to have a kite carry one’s own away.
One does not use a sword to kill a snail.
One gets bitten by a snake only once.
One takes care of one’s own: when a bachelor roasts yam, he shares it with his sheep.
Poverty destroys a man’s reputation.
The grains of corn in a bottle get viewed with disdain by the hen.
The influence of the fountain makes the brook flow.
The viper allows no insolence.
There’s no God like the throat, it accepts offerings every day.
What you give you get, ten times over.
When a king’s palace burns down, the re-built palace is more beautiful.
When your neighbour’s horse falls into a pit, you should not rejoice at it, for your own child may fall into it too.
Where you will sit when you are old shows where you stood in youth.
Whoever sees mucus in the nose of the king is the one who cleans it.
A child lacks wisdom, and some say that what is important is that the child does not die; what kills more surely than lack of wisdom?
A wise man who knows proverbs, reconciles difficulties.
You are given some stew and you add water, you must be wiser than the cook.
By labor comes wealth.
Lack of money is lack of friends; if you have money at your disposal, every dog and goat will claim to be related to you.
The wealth which enslaves the owner isn’t wealth.
What you give you get, ten times over.
Anyone who sees beauty and does not look at it will soon be poor.
Anyone who sees beauty and does not look at it will soon be poor.
Two rams cannot drink from the same bucket at the same time.
A person who stammers would eventually say "father".
Disobedience is the father of insolence.
When you stand with the blessings of your mother and God, it matters not who stands against you.
The king’s palace that got burnt added beauty to it.
He who eats well speaks well or it is a question of insanity.
Even after healing, a man once mad would still shout "HOI" once in a while.
You can’t stop a pig from wallowing in the mud.
The young cock crows as he hears the old one.
If you don’t sell your head, no one will buy it.
One takes care of one’s own: when a bachelor roasts yam, he share’s it with his sheep.
The man who has bread to eat does not appreciate the severity of a famine.
If you damage the character of another, you damage your own.
There was a threat yesterday and tragedy struck today, who doesn’t know that it’s the threatener of yesterday that is responsible for the tragedy.
It is a thief that can trace the footsteps of another thief on a rock.
It is head fish uses to swim through water.
The pot gets all the sweet, the lid nothing but steam.
‘i nearly killed the bird.’ no one can eat ‘nearly’ in a stew.
Fear a silent man. He has lips like a drum.
If we stand tall it is because we stand on the backs of those who came before us.
If something that was going to chop off your head only knocked off your cap, you should be grateful.
The soup does not move round in an elder’s belly.
The white chicken does not realize its age.
The young cannot teach tradition to the old.
It takes a whole village to raise a child.
nigerian.description: The society is responsible for the moral characters it creates and everyone in a community should be responsible for helping to train a child irrespective of who the parents are; offering correction where they are needed.

nigerian.text: The person that eat late, will not eat spoiled food.
Words are like spears: Once they leave your lips they can never come back.
The bell rings loudest in your own home.
To catch a monkey, you must do like a monkey.
No one can uproot the tree which God has planted.
If a big masquerade claims it doesn’t see the smaller masquerade, the small masquerade will also claim it doesn’t see the big masquerade.
One who waits for chance may wait a year.
Nobody knows the mysteries which lie at the bottom of the ocean.
The butterfly that brushes against thorns will tear its wings.
Its a new season, a new era.
Where you will sit when you are old shows where you stood in youth.
Covetousness is the father of unfulfilled desires.
Only what you have combated for will last.
Stretch your hands as far as they reach, grab all you can grab.
When the door is closed, you must learn to slide across the crack of the sill.
Prolonged endurance is what yields elderly maturity.
He who throws a stone in the market will hit his relative.
Many words do not fill a basket .
Charity begins at Home.
When your neighbor’s horse falls into a pit, you should not rejoice at it, for your own child may fall into it too.
Gossipers always suspect that others are talking about them.
For no man could be blessed without the acceptance of his own head.
Rather than an abatement of her viciousness, a witch gives birth to only female children and witchcraft multiplies .
Hardship here and there would definitely yield a broken personality.
Calculation is the master of bleeping.
You cannot shave a man’s head in his absence.
When the white man is about to leave a garden for good, he wrecks it.
Discretion is a better part of velour.
What an elder sees sitting; the young can’t see standing.
Never kill a man who says nothing.
The only insurance against fire is to have two houses.
He who does not mend his clothes will soon have none.
Allah preserve us from "If only I’d known!"
Accomplishment of purpose is better than making a profit.
Being happy is better than being king.
People in trouble remember God.
He who boasts much can do little.
A person is a guest for one or two days, but becomes an intruder on the third.
If the owner of the goat is not afraid to travel by night, the owner of a hyena certainly will not be.
From the well of envy, only a fool drinks the water.
Fishing without a net is just bathing.
He who marries a beauty marries trouble.
The crocodile does not die under the water so that we can call the monkey to celebrate its funeral.
One cry of "Thief!" and the whole marketplace is on the lookout.
Grass does not grow on the nose of a thief.
Voluntary work is better than slavery.
If you neglect the pot, it boils over and extinguishes the fire.
The death that will kill a man begins as an appetite.
The woman is cold water that kills you; deep water that you drown in.
Guilt is like the footprint of a hippopotamus.
It is the fear of offence that makes men swallow poison.
The lion’s power lies in our fear of him.
Evil knows where evil sleeps.
It is more fun doing evil than putting it right.
The hunter does not rub himself in oil and lie by the fire to sleep.
Fire has no brother.
The one-eyed man thanks God only when he sees a man blind in both eyes.
The blind say that eyes have no sense of smell.
He who is sick will not refuse medicine.
If you want to give a sick man medicine, let him first be really ill — so that he can see how well the medicine works.
The quarrel that doesn’t concern you is pleasant to hear about.
What the child says, he has heard at home.
One pebble doesn’t make a floor.
The house roof fights the rain, but he who is sheltered ignores it.
He who lives in the attic knows where the roof leaks.
You can’t use your hand to force the sun to set.
Hurrying and worrying are not the same as strength.
When you are sick you promise a goat, but when you are well again make do with a chicken.
When the mouse laughs at the cat, there is a hole nearby.
If all seeds that fall were to grow, then no one could follow the path under the trees.
No matter how dark it is, the hand always knows the way tothe mouth.
If there is character, ugliness becomes beauty; if there is none, beauty becomes ugliness.
Ugliness with a good character is better than beauty.
The mouth that eats pepper is the one that the pepper influences.
Choose your fellow traveller before you start on your journey.
Choose your neighbors before you buy your house.
The day you are leaving is not the time to start your preparations.
A person always breaking off from work never finishes anything.
The family is like the forest. If you are outside, it is dense; if you are inside, you see that each tree has its own position.
The well gives, but the bucket refuses.
The bird flies high, but always returns to earth.
Earth is the queen of beds.
Although the snake does not fly it has caught the bird whose home is in the sky.
If a monkey is amongest dogs, why won’t it start barking.
Don’t look for speed in a cheap horse; be content if it neighs.
Being happy in one’s home is better than being a chief.
Even in Mecca people make money.
Fine words do not produce food.
Words are sweet but they can never replace food.
The river may dry up but she keeps her name.
The frog does not jump in the daytime without reason.
If you put a razor in your mouth, you will spit blood.
No matter how dark it is, the hand always knows the way to the mouth.
A woman who has not been twice married cannot know what a perfect marriage is.
He who runs from the white ant may stumble upon the stinging ant.
A smiling face dispels unhappiness.
If you rise too early, the dew will wet you.
He who does not lose his way by night will not lose his way by day.
A traveler to distant places should make no enemies.
Choose your fellow traveler before you start on your journey.
Someone else’s legs are no good to you when you’re travelling.
Children of the same mother do not always agree.
Lending is the firstborn of poverty.
The lizard that jumped from the high iroko tree said he would praise himself if no one else did.
The stars shine brightest when the moon is gone.
The one being carried does not realize how far away the town is.
Hold on to a true friend with both hands.
The head of your neighbor is a kingdom and his heart a wood.
Horns do not grow before the head.
The whip hits at the legs, not the guilt.
The body of joy is not so big.
No sane person sharpens his machete to cut a banana tree.
The death that will kill a man begins as an appetite.
When one is in trouble, one remembers God.
The quarrel that doesn’t concern you is pleasant to hear about.
Man is like pepper — you only know him when you’ve ground him.
When the music changes, so does the dance.
In the moment of crisis, the wise build bridges and the foolish build dams.
Before firing, you must take aim.
When one is in trouble, one remembers God.
When you cook a guinea fowl, the partridge gets a headache.
If a monkey is amongst dogs, why won’t it start barking.
You know who you love, but you can’t know who loves you.
You cannot compare the living with the dead.
When the right hand washes the left hand and the left hand washes the right hand, both hands become clean.
When the mouse laughs at the cat there is a hole nearby.
What is sensible today may be derangement at another time.
What an old man sees while lying down, a young man can never see even when he climbs up in a tree.
Water may cover the footprint on the ground but it does not cover the words of the mouth.
Until lions have their own historians, accounts of the hunt will always celebrate the hunter.
The man that won’t marry a woman with other admirers won’t marry a woman at all.
The disobedient fowl obeys in a pot of soup.
The day on which one starts out is not the time to start one’s preparations.
The child of an elephant will not be a dwarf.
That which brings misfortune is not big.
Success is 10% ability, and 90% sweat.
Some birds avoid the water, ducks look for it.
Seeing is better than hearing.
Rain does not make friends with anybody — it falls on any person it meets outside.
Profit is profit even in Mecca.
Overabundance is not far from want.
Only the thing for which you have struggled will last.
Only a mother would carry the child that bites.
One who has been bitten by a snake lives in fear of worms.
One goat cannot carry another goat’s tail.
Now the marriage begins, says the woman who has been beaten with thorns.
Not to oversee workmen, is to leave your purse open.
Not to know is bad; not to want to know is worse.
Mud houses don’t burn.
More than one mother can make tasty soup.
Money kills more than do weapons.
Midday sun is the remedy for a cold.
Meat does not eat meat.
Marriage is like a groundnut, you have to crack it to see what is inside.
Let’s fight, let’s fight, no one knows whom fighting would favor.
It takes all sorts to make a world.
It takes a village to raise a child.
It is the woman whose child has been eaten by a witch who best knows the evils of witchcraft.
It is the first step that is difficult.
If you have run out of gunpowder, use your gun as a club.
If you give a man a fish, you feed him for a day, if you teach him to fish; you feed him for a lifetime.
If you fill your mouth with a razor, you will spit blood.
If you fail to take away a strong man’s sword when he is on the ground, will you do it when he gets up?
If you can’t dance well, you’d better not get up.
If the stomachache were in the foot, one would go lame.
If the bull would throw you, lie down.
If death be terrible, the fault is not in death, but thee.
If crocodiles eat their own eggs, what would they do to the flesh of a frog?
If a monkey is amongst dogs, why won’t it start barking?
If a blind man says, "Let’s throw stones," be assured that he has stepped on one.
Hyenas are caught with stinking bait.
However poor the elephant, it will be worth more than ten frogs.
However hard a thing is thrown into the air, it always falls to the ground.
Hold a true friend with both your hands.
He, who wishes to barter, does not like his belongings.
Give me a push from my back, does not mean give me a hunchback.
Fowls will not spare a cockroach that falls in their mist.
Familiarity breeds contempt; distance breeds respect.
Every kind of love is love, but self-love is supreme among them.
Every fault is laid at the door of the hyena, but it does not steal a bale of cloth.
Black goats must be caught early, before it gets dark.
Birth is the only remedy against death.
Ashes fly back into the face of him who throws them.
As long as you stay in a group, the lion will stay hungry.
An old man is there to talk.
Allah preserve us from "If only I’d known!" .
Allah made the silk-cotton tree beautiful, so let the fig tree cease being angry.
All is never said.
Abundance will make cotton pull a stone.
A wealthy man will always have followers.
A tree is known by its fruit.
A tree is best measured when it’s down.
A tree does not move unless there is wind.
A rat is not born a rabbit.
A pig that is used to wallowing in the mud looks for a clean person to rub against.
A man does not wander far from where his corn is roasting.
A hunter who has only one arrow does not shoot with careless aim.
A friendly person is never a good-for-nothing.
A fowl does not forget where it lays its eggs.
